title: Gold (1934) dir. Karl Hartl  [Deutsch, w Eng subtitles]
description:
Gold  (1934) directed by Karl Hartl for UFA Studios;   a Kino Release 2016

B/W in German language with optional English subtitles which are original
to the DVD.  In VLC select the subtitles from the player menu.

Run time:  1 hr 33 mins

IMDb: /tt0025189

Summary from IMDb

After his colleague and a mentor, Prof. Achenbach dies in a set-up accident, while trying to produce gold from the lead, Werner Holk seeks revenge. Meanwhile, a British millionaire suggests that Holk work on him on a similar project. 
 	
Credits 

	Directors of photography, GÃ¼nther Rittau, Otto Baecker, Werner Bohne ;
        music, Hans-Otto Borgmann.
Cast 	

Hans Albers, 
Brigitte Helm, 
Michael Bohnen, 
Lien Deyers, 
Friedrich Kayssler.

My notes

There are two films I'll be file sharing in this group. This is the first.  Aside from the provocative title , this is not Eric Von Stroheim's "Greed."   "Gold" is from the UFA studio in the FW Murnau collection.  Film historians can say more about it but it is a recent release and it is the first time I've seen it.

What makes :Gold" it special as with the one that follows called "The Sky Calls"  which is Russian, the technical achievement in size and scope is significant.  As far back as the Russian silent Film "Aelita Queen of Mars" (public domain and available at The Internet Archive,)  the large stage is utilized as it might be in grand opera-- in the work of Edward Gordon Craig as an 
example.

In "Gold" the German Expressionistic elements are seen  as well.  For all these reasons plus the moral tale of the hazards of making gold, "Gold" is a treat for the eye and is in every way state of the art for it's time.

To be precise this is a remaster rather an a "restored" version.  A restored
film is always preferred since the process is more intensive in the task of removing film artifacts one frame at a time.

This torrent is a sample for those who would get the original DVD for their film history libraries and for others to enjoy everywhere.

Notes written September 2, 2016
